# <b> Scripts </b> {.tabset}

<p style="font-size:11px; line-height: 1; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020;">There are 3 writing system used in Japanese namely the **Kanji**, **Hiragana** and the **Katakana** scripts.</p>

## Kanji {.tabset}
<p style="font-size:11px; line-height: 1; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020;">**Kanji** was based on Chinese characters which represents a word and a meaning.</p>

### L5 {.tabset}

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}

scknj5 <- scknj5[sample(1:nrow(scknj5)),]

reactable(
  scknj5,
  columns = list(
    Kanji = colDef(
      # Show species under character names
      cell = function(value, index) {
        Meaning <- scknj5$Meaning[index]
        Meaning <- if (!is.na(Meaning)) Meaning else ""
        NR <- scknj5$NR[index]
        NR <- if (!is.na(NR)) NR else ""
        KR <- scknj5$KR[index]
        KR <- if (!is.na(KR)) KR else ""
        tagList(
          div(style = list(fontSize = 30, fontWeight = 500), value),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 9, color = '#008000'), NR),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 9, color = '#800000'), KR),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 9, fontWeight = 500), Meaning)
        )
      },
      align = "center"
    ),
    W1 = colDef(
      cell = function(value, index) {
        M1 <- scknj5$M1[index]
        M1 <- if (!is.na(M1)) M1 else ""
```

### MC.1.0: I-Adjectives {.tabset}
<p style="font-size:11px; line-height: 1; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020;">**I-Adjectives**  are words that describe nouns and pronouns. Usually end with "i".</p>

#### Structure

![](iadj.png)
<h6> </h6>

------------------------------------------------------------------------

#### Examples

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}

nadj2.a <- nadj2  %>% slice(1:210) %>% rename(Sentences = S1, Translation = T1)

reactable(
  nadj2.a,
  columns = list(
    Words = colDef(
      cell = function(value, index) {
        Reading <- nadj2.a$Reading[index]
        Reading <- if (!is.na(Reading)) Reading else ""
        Meaning <- nadj2.a$Meaning[index]
        Meaning <- if (!is.na(Meaning)) Meaning else ""
        tagList(
          div(style = list(fontSize = 21, fontWeight = 500, color = '#404040'), value),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 11, color = '#404040'), Reading),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 10, fontWeight = 500, color = '#404040'), Meaning)
        )
      },
      align = "center"
    ),
    
    Sentences = colDef(
      minWidth = 180,
      cell = function(value, index) {
        Translation <- nadj2.a$Translation[index]
        Translation <- if (!is.na(Translation)) Translation else ""
        tagList(
          div(style = list(fontSize = 16, fontWeight = 500, color = '#404040'), value),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 9, color = '#404040'), Translation)
        )
      },
      align = "left"
    ),

    Translation = colDef(show = FALSE),
    Meaning = colDef(show = FALSE),
    Reading = colDef(show = FALSE)

  ),
  defaultPageSize = 5,
  theme = reactableTheme(
    # Vertically center cells
    cellStyle = list(display = "flex", flexDirection = "column", justifyContent = "center", height = 100, fontSize = "11px"),
    searchInputStyle = list(
      paddingLeft = "8px",
      paddingTop = "8px",
      paddingBottom = "8px",
      width = "100%"
    )
  ),
  showPageInfo = FALSE, bordered = TRUE, searchable = TRUE, paginationType = "numbers",
  
  style = list(fontFamily = "Noto Sans JP, Hiragino Maru Gothic ProN, Anonymous Pro , Helvetica Neue", fontSize = "11px")
)
```

<p style="font-size:11px; line-height: 1; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020;">**Na-Adjectives** doesn't conjugate or change it's form. In order to form a past tense, negative tense or other forms, a copula is attach to suffice.</p>

<p style="font-size:11px; line-height: 1; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020;">**Nouns** doesn't conjugate or change it's form. In order to form a past tense, negative tense or other forms, a copula is attach to suffice.</p>

### MC.4.0: Adverbs {.tabset}
<p style="font-size:11px; line-height: 1; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020;">**Adverbs**  are words that precede and modify verbs, adjectives, other adverbs, and even whole clauses.</p>

#### Structure

<p style="font-size:13px; line-height: 0.5; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020; font-weight: bold">**‚ë† Forms: Derivation**</p>

###### **Adjective Stem ‚á¢ Adverb**

    „Éª„ÅÜ„Åæ„ÅÑ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅÜ„Åæ„Åè„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ skillfully, well
    „Éª„ÇÑ„Åô„ÅÑ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÇÑ„Åô„Åè„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ inexpensively, cheaply
    „Éª„Åµ„Åã„ÅÑ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åµ„Åã„Åè„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ deeply, intimately
    „Éª„ÅØ„ÇÑ„ÅÑ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅØ„ÇÑ„Åè„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ early, soon, quickly
    „Éª„Åô„Åî„ÅÑ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åô„Åî„Åè„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ awfully, very, immensely
    „Éª„Åø„Åò„Åã„ÅÑ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åø„Åò„Åã„Åè„ÄÄ‚ó¶ shortly, briefly
    „Éª„Åè„Çè„Åó„ÅÑ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åè„Çè„Åó„Åè„ÄÄ‚ó¶ in detail, fully

###### **Na Adjective ‚á¢ Adverb**

    „Éª„Åç„Çå„ÅÑ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åç„Çå„ÅÑ„Å´„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ neatly, carefully
    „Éª„Å®„Åè„Åπ„Å§„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Å®„Åè„Åπ„Å§„Å´„ÄÄ‚ó¶ speacilly, particularlly
    „Éª„Åü„ÅÑ„Åõ„Å§„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åü„ÅÑ„Åõ„Å§„Å´„ÄÄ‚ó¶ carefully, with great care

###### **No Adjective ‚á¢ Adverb**

    „Éª„ÅØ„Å†„Åã„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅØ„Å†„Åã„Åß„ÄÄ‚ó¶ nakedly

###### **Onomatope ‚á¢ Adverb**

    „Éª„Å°„ÇÉ„Çì„Å®„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Å°„ÇÉ„Çì„Å®„ÄÄ‚ó¶ properly, deligently, exactly
    „Éª„É®„Éú„É®„Éú„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„É®„Éú„É®„Éú„ÄÄ‚ó¶ shaky, unsteadily
    „Éª„Åô„Å£„Åã„Çä„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åô„Å£„Åã„Çä„ÄÄ‚ó¶ completely, entirely

<!-- <h> -->

    „Éª„ÇÜ„Å£„Åè„Çä„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÇÜ„Å£„Åè„Çä(„Å®)„ÄÄ‚ó¶ slowly, leisurely
    „Éª„Éî„Ç´„Éî„Ç´„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Éî„Ç´„Éî„Ç´(„Å®)„ÄÄ‚ó¶ sparkly
    „Éª„Åµ„Çâ„Åµ„Çâ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åµ„Çâ„Åµ„Çâ(„Å®)„ÄÄ‚ó¶ shaky, unsteadily

###### **Verbs ‚á¢ Adverb**

    „Éª„ÅØ„Åò„ÇÅ„Çã„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅØ„Åò„ÇÅ„Å¶„ÄÄ‚ó¶ first time
    „Éª„Åç„Çè„ÇÅ„Çã„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åç„Çè„ÇÅ„Å¶„ÄÄ‚ó¶ extremely, exceedingly
    „Éª„Åô„Åê„Çå„Çã„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åô„Åê„Çå„Å¶„ÄÄ‚ó¶ exceedingly
    „Éª„ÅÑ„Åù„Åê„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅÑ„Åù„ÅÑ„Åß„ÄÄ‚ó¶ quickly
    „ÉªËøΩ„ÅÜ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åä„Å£„Å¶„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ later on, shortly, in due course
    „Éª„Åã„Åè„Çå„Çã„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åã„Åè„Çå„Å¶„ÄÄ‚ó¶ secretly

###### **Verbs (Duplication) ‚á¢ Adverb**

    „Éª„Åä„Åù„Çå„Çã„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åä„Åù„Çã-„Åä„Åù„Çã„ÄÄ‚ó¶ timidly

    „Éª„Åæ„Åô„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åæ„Åô-„Åæ„Åô„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ increasingly
    „Éª„Å™„Åè„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Å™„Åè-„Å™„Åè„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ in tears
    „Éª„Åø„Çã„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åø„Çã-„Åø„Çã„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ as you look on, very fast, in a twinkle

###### **Nouns (Adverbial Nouns) ‚á¢ Adverb**

###### These are used as an adeverb to express time

    „Éª„ÅÑ„Åæ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅÑ„Åæ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ now 
    „Éª„Åç„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åç„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ today
    „Éª„Åç„ÅÆ„ÅÜ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åç„ÅÆ„ÅÜ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ yesterday
    „Éª„ÅÇ„Åó„Åü„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅÇ„Åó„Åü„ÄÄ‚ó¶ tomorrow
    „Éª„ÅÇ„Åï„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅÇ„Åï„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ morning
    „Éª„Å≤„Çã„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Å≤„Çã„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ noon
    „Éª„Çà„Çã„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Çà„Çã„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ night
    „Éª„ÅØ„Çã„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅØ„Çã„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ spring
    „Éª„Å™„Å§„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Å™„Å§„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ summer
    „Éª„ÅÇ„Åç„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅÇ„Åç„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ autumn
    „Éª„Åµ„ÇÜ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åµ„ÇÜ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ winter
    „Éª„ÇÄ„Åã„Åó„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÇÄ„Åã„Åó„ÄÄ‚ó¶ old times

###### **Nouns„ÉªVerbs + Compound Particle (Pre-Verbal Form) ‚á¢ Adverbials**

###### Modifies, describes or gives more information about the verb it's closely connected

    „ÉªÊó•Êú¨„ÅÆÊñáÂåñ„Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶Ë©±„Åô
    „ÉªÂπ¥„ÇíÂèñ„Çã„Å´„Å§„Çå„Å¶Ë®òÊÜ∂Âäõ„ÅåË°∞„Åà„Çã

#### Types

<p style="font-size:13px; line-height: 0.5; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020; font-weight: bold">**‚ë† Adverbs of Manner**</p>

###### **Indicates the way some action is being performed**

    „Éª„Åç„Çå„ÅÑ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åç„Çå„ÅÑ„Å´„ÄÄ‚ó¶ neatly
    „Éª„Åô„Å£„Åã„Çä„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åô„Å£„Åã„Çä„ÄÄ‚ó¶ completely
    „Éª„ÇÜ„Å£„Åè„Çä„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÇÜ„Å£„Åè„Çä„ÄÄ‚ó¶ well

    „Éª„ÅØ„Å£„Åç„Çä„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅØ„Å£„Åç„Çä„ÄÄ‚ó¶ clearly
    „Éª„Åæ„Å£„Åü„Åè„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åæ„Å£„Åü„Åè„ÄÄ‚ó¶ really
    „Éª„Å°„ÇÉ„Çì„Å®„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Å°„ÇÉ„Çì„Å®„ÄÄ‚ó¶ properly
    „Éª„Åç„Å°„Çì„Å®„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åç„Å°„Çì„Å®„ÄÄ‚ó¶ accurately
    „Éª„Å∂„Åò„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Å∂„Åò„Å´„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ safely
    „Éª„Åï„Å£„Åù„Åè„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åï„Å£„Åù„Åè„ÄÄ‚ó¶ immediately      

<p style="font-size:13px; line-height: 0.5; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020; font-weight: bold">**‚ë° Adverbs of Degree and Quantity**</p>

###### **Indicates the degree to which the word it modifies**

    „Éª„ÇÇ„Å£„Å®„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÇÇ„Å£„Å®„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ more, even more, further

    „Éª„ÅÑ„Å°„Å∞„Çì„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅÑ„Å°„Å∞„Çì„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ most, number one
    „Éª„Å†„ÅÑ„Å∂„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Å†„ÅÑ„Å∂„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ pretty, considerably
    „Éª„Å≤„Åò„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Å≤„Åò„Çá„ÅÜ„Å´„ÄÄ‚ó¶ very, extremely
    „Éª„Åª„Å®„Çì„Å©„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åª„Å®„Çì„Å©„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ almost, mostly
    „Éª„ÅÑ„Å£„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„ÅÑ„Å£„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ entirety, (not) at all, never
    „Éª„Åò„Å§„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åò„Å§„Å´„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ really/very clever
    „Éª„Åã„Å™„Çä„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åã„Å™„Çä„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ considerably, fairly
    „Éª„Åë„Å£„Åì„ÅÜ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åë„Å£„Åì„ÅÜ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ quite, fairly, considerably
    „Éª„Åç„Çè„ÇÅ„Å¶„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åç„Çè„ÇÅ„Å¶„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ extremely, exceedingly
    „Éª„Åô„Å£„Åã„Çä„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åô„Å£„Åã„Çä„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ completely, entirely
    „Éª„Åü„ÅÑ„Å∏„Çì„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Åü„ÅÑ„Å∏„Çì„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ very, greatly, terribly
    „Éª„Å®„Å¶„ÇÇ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚á¢„ÄÄ„Å®„Å¶„ÇÇ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ„ÄÄ‚ó¶ very, exceedingly

#### Examples

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}

adv1.a <- adv1 %>% slice(1:160) %>% rename(Sentences = S1, Translation = T1)

reactable(
  adv1.a,
  columns = list(
    Word = colDef(
      cell = function(value, index) {
        Reading <- adv1.a$Reading[index]
        Reading <- if (!is.na(Reading)) Reading else ""
        Meaning <- adv1.a$Meaning[index]
        Meaning <- if (!is.na(Meaning)) Meaning else ""
        tagList(
          div(style = list(fontSize = 21, fontWeight = 500, color = '#404040'), value),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 11, color = '#404040'), Reading),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 10, color = '#404040'), Meaning)
        )
      },
      align = "center"
    ),
    
    Sentences = colDef(
      minWidth = 180,
      cell = function(value, index) {
        Translation <- adv1.a$Translation[index]
        Translation <- if (!is.na(Translation)) Translation else ""
        tagList(
          div(style = list(fontSize = 16, fontWeight = 500, color = '#404040'), value),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 9, color = '#404040'), Translation)
        )
      },
      align = "left"
    ),
    
    Translation = colDef(show = FALSE),
    Meaning = colDef(show = FALSE),
    Reading = colDef(show = FALSE)

  ),
  defaultPageSize = 5,
  theme = reactableTheme(
    # Vertically center cells
    cellStyle = list(display = "flex", flexDirection = "column", justifyContent = "center", height = 90, fontSize = "11px"),
    searchInputStyle = list(
      paddingLeft = "8px",
      paddingTop = "8px",
      paddingBottom = "8px",
      width = "100%"
    )
  ),
  showPageInfo = FALSE, bordered = TRUE, searchable = TRUE, paginationType = "numbers",
  
  style = list(fontFamily = "Noto Sans JP, Hiragino Maru Gothic ProN, Anonymous Pro , Helvetica Neue", fontSize = "11px")
)
```

### MC.10: Affixes {.tabset}

#### Prefix {.tabset}

<p style="font-size:11px; line-height: 1; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020;">A **prefix** is a short element that is attached to the beginning of a word to add an additional meaning to or to change the meaning of the word.</p>

    „Éª„Åä„ÄÄ„ÄÄolite prefix      
    „ÉªÂèØ„ÄÄ„ÄÄable, ible        
    „ÉªÂêÑ„ÄÄ„ÄÄeach, several     
    „ÉªÁâá„ÄÄ„ÄÄone               
    „ÉªÈÄÜ„ÄÄ„ÄÄcounter, reverse  
    „Éª„Åî„ÄÄ„ÄÄpolite prefix      
    „ÉªÊ∫ñ„ÄÄ„ÄÄsemi, quasi, assoc 
    „ÉªË´∏„ÄÄ„ÄÄmany, various
    „ÉªÁ¥†„ÄÄ„ÄÄbare               
    „ÉªÂÖ®„ÄÄ„ÄÄwhole, entire
    „ÉªÁ∑è„ÄÄ„ÄÄgrand, general     
    „ÉªÊï∞„ÄÄ„ÄÄseveral, a number of     

<h6> </h6>

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}

prefixs <- prefixs[sample(1:nrow(prefixs)),]

reactable(
  prefixs,
  columns = list(
    Words = colDef(
      cell = function(value, index) {
        Meaning <- prefixs$Meaning[index]
        Meaning <- if (!is.na(Meaning)) Meaning else ""
        tagList(
          div(style = list(fontSize = 21, fontWeight = 500, color = '#404040'), value),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 10, color = '#404040'), Meaning)
        )
      },
      align = "center"
    ),
    #
    Sentence = colDef(
      minWidth = 180,
      cell = function(value, index) {
        Translation <- prefixs$Translation[index]
        Translation <- if (!is.na(Translation)) Translation else ""
        tagList(
          div(style = list(fontSize = 16, fontWeight = 500, color = '#404040'), value),
          div(style = list(fontSize = 9, color = '#404040'), Translation)
        )
      },
      align = "left"
    ),

    Translation = colDef(show = FALSE),
    Meaning = colDef(show = FALSE)

  ),
  defaultPageSize = 1,
  theme = reactableTheme(
    # Vertically center cells
    cellStyle = list(display = "flex", flexDirection = "column", justifyContent = "center", height = 90, fontSize = "11px"),
    searchInputStyle = list(
      paddingLeft = "8px",
      paddingTop = "8px",
     paddingBottom = "8px",
      width = "100%"
    )
  ),
  showPageInfo = FALSE, bordered = TRUE, searchable = FALSE, paginationType = "numbers",
  
  style = list(fontFamily = "Noto Sans JP, Hiragino Maru Gothic ProN, Anonymous Pro , Helvetica Neue", fontSize = "11px")
)
```

#### Types

<p style="font-size:13px; line-height: 0.5; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020; font-weight: bold">**Transitive: Action**</p>

Transitive verbs are verbs that take a direct object.

<p style="font-size:13px; line-height: 0.5; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020; font-weight: bold">**Intransitive: Descriptive**</p>

Intransitive verbs are verbs that do not take a direct object.

##### Examples

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}

phrslprt <- phrslprt[sample(1:nrow(phrslprt)),]

reactable(
  phrslprt,
  columns = list(
    Particles = colDef(
      cell = function(value, index) {
        Meaning <- phrslprt$Meaning[index]
        Meaning <- if (!is.na(Meaning)) Meaning else ""
        Format <- phrslprt$Format[index]
        Format <- if (!is.na(Format)) Format else ""
        tagList(
```

###### **shi** particle connects one or multiple reasons but not naming all of it

    „Éª„Åì„ÅÆ‰∫ã‰ª∂„ÅØ„Åª„ÅºÁµÇÊÅØ„Åó„Åü„Åó‰∫åÂ∫¶„Å®Ëµ∑„Åì„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÅØ„Å™„ÅÑ
    „ÉªThis incident has more or less ended and will never happen again

###### **„ÉªSentence(V/I-Adj/N/Na-Adj) + toka + Sentence**

###### **toka** cite a thing or an instance amongs other things or situation

    „Éª„Åò„ÇÉ„ÅÇÊò†Áîª„ÇíÂ≠óÂπï„Å™„Åó„ÅßË¶ã„Çã„Å®„ÅãÊó•Êú¨„ÅÆÈü≥Ê•Ω„ÇíËÅû„Åè„Å®„Åã„ÅØ„Å©„ÅÜÔºü

<p style="font-size:13px; line-height: 0.5; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020; font-weight: bold">**‚ë¢ BUT-Relation: Conjunctive Particles**</p>

###### **„ÉªSentence + kedo + Sentence**

###### **„ÉªSentence + keredomo + Sentence**

<p style="font-size:13px; line-height: 0.5; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020; font-weight: bold">**‚ë£ Connectives„ÉªConjunctions**</p>

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
reactable(
  spphr.x,
  columns = list(
    Phrase = colDef(
```

### PT7.0: Grammar {.tabset}

#### Concept {.tabset}

<p style="font-size:11px; line-height: 1; font-family: Noto Sans JP;  color: #202020;">**Grammar** provides structure in a language. A pattern, syntax or set of rules that must be followed in order to convey a correct meaning or context of a sentence.</p>

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
reactable(
  v1hme1,
  columns = list(

      # Show species under character names
      cell = function(value, index) {

        Transcript <- if (!is.na(Transcript)) Transcript else "Unknown"
        tagList(
```
